quotes.t: Of all the myths that have grown up around Alan Greenspan, the most powerful is the idea that he's willfully {qword}inscrutable{/qword}.
That wily politicians might adopt Franklin's distinction between appearance and reality to become {qword}inscrutable{/qword} confidence men did not seem to trouble him.
Supersymmetry is a magic mirror, and everything in what we imagine to be the real world has its ghostly, {qword}inscrutable{/qword} mirror image.

et: Middle English, from Late Latin {it}inscrutabilis{/it}, from Latin {it}in-{/it} + {it}scrutari{/it} to search {ma}{mat|scrutiny|}{/ma}
shortdef: not readily investigated, interpreted, or understood : mysterious
